page.title: 12Winnall Caravan Park.
page.content: The Winnall Caravan Park began during the war when the refugees came to get away from the bombing in the cities. The oldest part of the caravan park is the Georgian house which belonged to the squire in the year 1735. Now the family living in the house only use half of it as rather big. Opposite the house there is an old barn which used to be on the York to London run where the horses were exchanged before crossing the river by ferry.The surrounding is grazing land with various trees such as ash,beech, sycamore and birch.They were mostly planted by the campsite.The fields are used for potatoes,wheat and sugarbeet. The campsite provides activities such as a club and a fishery. By Debbie Barkas (aged 13).
